body:
Thanks, @Fivell is there a way to configure this as the default order for all filters or per namespace?
Like
```
ActiveAdmin.setup do |config|
    config.filters = [:starts_with, :equals, :contains, :ends_with]
end
```

@lauraeci , there is no such config at the moment, string filters positions are hardcoded.  You can patch default behaviour globally using ruby 

Such rails initialiser might work for you.
 
```ruby
module MyStringInputExt
  def self.included(base)
    base.class_eval do
      @filters = [:starts_with, :equals, :contains, :ends_with]
    end
  end
end 
ActiveAdmin::Inputs::Filters::StringInput.send(:include, MyStringInputExt)
```

issue.title: search options overriding for numeric and string filters (specs and docs)

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

body:
Thanks @Fivell. But when I use the solution in rails v3.2.22.2 and active-admin v0.6.6, below error is coming. Kindly help with this one.

**uninitialized constant ActiveAdmin::Inputs::Filters (NameError)**

After deep digging, I got the answer.

**For active-admin v0.6.6, it should be** 
``` ruby
ActiveAdmin::Inputs::FilterStringInput.filters.clear
ActiveAdmin::Inputs::FilterStringInput.filter(:equals, :starts_with, :ends_with, :contains)
```
**Replacing Filters::StringInput to FilterStringInput will work**

Probably [the filter names](https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/blob/master/lib/active_admin/inputs/filters/string_input.rb#L9) were changed at some point. This is what works for me:
```ruby
filter :name, filters: %i[eq cont start end]
```
